channel.title: 🪴 Pelayo Arbués on
channel.description: Recent content in 🪴 Pelayo Arbués on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: 202211141711 - Irrational beliefs and evidence
item.description: The idea that people will abandon their irrational beliefs on the strength of the evidence presented to them is itself an irrational belief, not supported by the evidence - George Lakoff

item.title: 202211141711 - Short term and long term metrics
item.description: Optimising the wrong metrics might make you win the finite game, but lose the infinite one. Beware what you chase.

item.title: 202211102211 - Team size trade-off. Coordination costs Vs collective intelligence
item.description: Many of us have faced this tradeoff. As our team grows bigger, coordination costs and waste rise. At the same time, the potential collective intelligence of the group also increases.

item.title: 202210241310 - Make'em talk
item.description: Data based projects are usually quite difficult to land because stakeholders requirements are fuzzy and ill-defined. The truth is that it is usually quite difficulty to define upfront data based products.

item.title: 202210201510 - Uplift Modeling
item.description: Uplift modeling tries to capture the difference in the propensity of a subject to performa an action if they have received an intervention vs not receiving the intervention.

item.title: 202210172210 - Bayesian reasoning
item.description: Bayesian style belief updating consists of a way of changing probabilistics beliefs in response to evidence. Bayes’ rule is the theorem that indicates how much we should change our minds when we learn a new fact or observe new evidence Arbital

item.title: 202210172210 - Rationalism takes us closer to the truth
item.description: Rationality is the systematic revision of our beliefs to make them map reality better. The achieved superior fit to the truth allows us to make better decisions and achieve our goals.

item.title: 202210172210 - The Rational Company
item.description: In the past years many companies have claimed to be adopting processes that allows them to be more intensively driven by data.

item.title: 202210140810 - Data Science wishful thinking
item.description: My favourite stage at the DS process is thinking about what data would be ideal to solve a particular problem.

item.title: 202210141110 - Como contratar DS y no desesperar
item.description: A raíz de la anterior publicación sobre cómo conseguir un primer empleo de Data Scientist recibí bastantes preguntas de managers con dudas sobre cómo afrontar el proceso de contratación.

item.title: 202210141310 - Data is not objective
item.description: Data has always been obtained with instruments and techniques that impose a particular structure to the information we aim to study.

item.title: 202209061709 - Improvements in product development processes at idealista
item.description: What do you think could be improved in the Analysis phase? In the analysis phase, we could work on making qualitative and quantitative analyses complementary.

item.title: 202205171305 - Toma de decisiones con y sin vuelta atrás
item.description: Toma de decisiones con y sin vuelta atrás Antes de tomar una decisión deberíamos de analizar la misma y metadecidir si esa decisión es reversible o no irreversible.

item.title: 202205031105 - Buscas tu primer empleo de Ciencia de Datos?
item.description: Desde junio de 2020 cada semana trato de tener una conversación con personas desconocidas que me contactan para charlar conmigo sobre distintos temas relacionados con el mundo de los datos.

item.title: 202203281703 - Agile for Data Science
item.description: My experience working with agile methodologies in Data Science projects is quite bitter. It did not work for small companies. Neither did it for the larger ones starting their journey in advanced analytics.

item.title: 202202052202 - Different managerial styles
item.description: There is not such a thing of one size fits all in management. Probably this is even worse in the case of data science, a whole range of professions that attract curious minds from every knowledge field.

item.title: 202202052202 - Understanding low level data science
item.description: Being able to understand the deep roots of the techniques allows you to truly grasp an idea of when to use them and even break the technique in pieces and use what you need.

item.title: 202202021502 - Mentoring as a form of leverage
item.description: The productivity (a.k.a leverage) of a developer/data scientist is measured as the impact produced by hour invested. At the beginning of our careers our impact is linear with the hours spent in a task, but as we grow in experience we can create exponential impact by mentoring junior people as explained in [[From entry level to senior+ developer - Multiply impact with developer leverage]].

item.title: 202202011102 - By-products of multiple processes
item.description: The chemistry industry calls verbund to a setup in which the inevitable by-product of a process is a resource for another, which again produces by-products that can be used in other processes and so on.

item.title: 202202011102 - Career advice on skill acquisition
item.description: An optimal strategy in order to become a top professional is not pursuing to become top 10% at one sole skill but to try to become top 25% in at least three different skills.

%% Zoottelkeeper: Beginning of the autogenerated index file list %% [[pelayoarbues/01. Slip-box/202202011102 - By-products of multiple processes|202202011102 - By-products of multiple processes]] [[pelayoarbues/01.

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary 🧠 sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
